generif.text: a gene within an intron of the tau gene; Q7R polymorphism appears to be over-represented in the homozygous state in late onset Alzheimer's disease subjects
The saitohin Q allele, a novel determinant of tau H1 haplotypes, may represent a causative factor involved in the determinism of several tauopathies, e.g., frontotemporal dementia.
At the STH gene only a common polymorphic change was found.
Increased risk of Alzheimer's disease associated with the STH RR genotype is limited to late-onset Alzheimer's disease.
The R allele of STH is associated with the H2 haplotype of tau; no correlation is found between R allele frequency and Alzheimer's or Parkinson's disease.
Observational study of gene-disease association and gene-gene interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
Saitohin interacts with peroxiredoxin 6, a unique member of that family that is bifunctional and the levels of which increase in Pick disease.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
We found no evidence that could support a major pathogenic role of STH and TAU haplotype in AD, FTD or PD.
Observational study of genotype prevalence. (HuGE Navigator)
Q allele of STH gene is over-represented in a tested group of patients with Huntington disease and might be considered a risk factor for HD like diseases.
Observational study of gene-disease association and gene-gene interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
Homozygous Q/Q of STH Q7R polymorphism was the only one genotype found in either LOAD group or controls. No R allele was detected in LOAD and control groups.

The Saitohin Q7R polymorphism is unlikely to contribute significantly to Alzheimer's disease susceptibility of the Han population in south China.
Observational study of gene-disease association and gene-gene interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
STH polymorphisms play a possibly shared role with those of serotinin transporter 5-HTTLPR gene as a susceptibility factor for Alzheimer's disease and frontotemperal lobar dementia.
effect of Saitohin on Abl-mediated phosphorylation appears to be allele-specific, providing evidence for a new cellular function for STH
Single polymorphisms within the saitohin gene were associated with increased cognitive impairment and functional dependence persons with moderate-to-advanced Alzheimer disease.
These results suggest a possible contribution of STH gene products on the heterogeneity of core frontal executive functions deterioration in schizophrenia
The rs6203857 polymorphism of the saitohin gene is a genetic risk factor for Parkinson's disease.

Results showed a significant interaction effect of COMT and STH polymorphisms on cognitive performances, strengthening the involvement of STH in cognitive impairments, especially in the domains commonly impaired in schizophrenia
results of this meta-analysis suggested that MAPT_238bp/STH Q7R polymorphisms might modulate the risk of Parkinson's disease susceptibility
Saitohin Q7R polymorphism is associated with late-onset Alzheimer's disease susceptibility among caucasian populations. (Meta-analysis)
Association of Saitohin gene rs62063857 polymorphism with dry type age-related macular degeneration.

BP.term: positive regulation of mRNA splicing, via spliceosome

name: saitohin
summary: Involved in positive regulation of mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in nucleus and perinuclear region of cytoplasm. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
